summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the filing of the sealed Non-Prosecution Agreement in the Epstein case. The email points out factual misstatements made by Jeffrey Epstein during his change of plea hearing concerning the Florida Science Foundation, including its incorporation date, its purported office location, and Epstein's claimed daily presence there.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the non-prosecution agreement. The email notes he made misstatements during his change of plea hearing regarding the Florida Science Foundation.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: The address provided for the Florida Science Foundation's office is his office suite. The email states the building directory and suite door do not reflect the Foundation's presence there.

connections.description: Epstein claimed the Florida Science Foundation's office was located in Goldberger's office suite, though no evidence of the Foundation's presence there was found.

events.title: Change of Plea Hearing for Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's change of plea hearing where he reportedly made misstatements about the Florida Science Foundation.

events.title: Incorporation of Florida Science Foundation
events.description: The Florida Science Foundation was incorporated, according to Division of Corporations documents, contradicting Epstein's claim it was formed "a couple of years ago".

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: A Non-Prosecution Agreement in the Epstein case was filed under seal with the court.

Jeffrey Epstein made misstatements during his change of plea hearing, claiming the Florida Science Foundation was incorporated "a couple of years ago" when it was actually incorporated in November 2007.

The address Epstein provided for the Florida Science Foundation's office was Jack Goldberger's office suite, but no evidence (building directory, suite door, security guard, tenants) supported the Foundation's existence at that location.
Epstein claimed he worked at the Foundation "every day," but he had not been in Palm Beach County in the six months prior to the email.
The email is from an Assistant U.S. Attorney, indicating prosecutorial awareness of potential false statements by Epstein to the court.
